name: Hope Street Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visit the city of Liverpool about 6 times a year at least and this has been our hotel of choice for much of that. Clean, comfortable, centrally located, great views over the city skyline, handy walking distance to Philharmonic pub & Orchestra concert halls. Super breakfast with plenty of fresh fruit and a good choice of cooked items freshly made (none of this self service plastic sausages lark!) and courteous professional staff. We will continue to use this hotel above others for as long as they keep this up!... and we are very fussy too.... we own a small country inn ourselves!
reviews.title: Our hotel of choice for regular Liverpool trips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic city views from our room. Pleasant, helpful staff. Food and service good.
reviews.title: A really enjoyable, relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Unfortunately I was only able to stay at the Hope Street Hotel for one night as I was on a business trip and our evening meal had been arranged by others, away from the hotel,so I was unable to sample, what I believe is delicious food, in TLCW restaurant. However the hotel surpassed my expectations. The reception staff were very welcoming; the room was attractive, well equipped and very comfortable. The lounge, bar area and restaurant were all well appointed and the bar staff prompt and helpful. The location was good and only a short walk to the shopping centre and university. During my walks I passed the two cathedrals, and decided they should be viewed properly. So I am already planning a return to Liverpool (this was my first visit) to spend a week-end exploring the city and returning to the Hope Street Hotel. I can't wait!
reviews.title: I can't wait to return....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Sadly I have to disagree with many of the reviewers of this hotel. I found it to be very average, even poor, in many respects.
reviews.title: Not special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The decor is clean and modern, with lots of white and brick. The restaurant is good, but quite expensive. However, the breakfast service is shambolic to say the least. Waits of more than half an hour for cooked food were not uncommon amongst our group as there is no buffet service for hot food. There just didn't seem to be enough staff and some spoke only basic English.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated between the two cathedrals and opposite the Philarmonic, this hotel is perfectly situated and boasts superb rooms many of which have great views of the City. Lots of natural wood, light and the staff are very friendly and professional. Nice restaurant to boot. Will return!
reviews.title: Unexpected gem in heart of great City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I found this hotel to be lacking in any style or personality. 1st room was tired and not clean enough. Furniture and soft furnishings were of poor quality. Second room (penthouse suite) was of a ridiculous design. Small hallway as you entered with tea/coffee/kettle but no tap to fill kettle. no minibar. Huge windows, which whilst a great design feature were not fitted with any blinds of curtains which meant that the people in the office block opposite could see in. Very steep staircase up to small seating area, again furnished with poor quality furniture and soft furnishings and not comfortable. Average bedroom and bathroom. There was however a fantastic view from the bedroom, with a terrace, which I should imagine would be lovely in the summer.
reviews.title: London prices for Liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful boutique hotel in a great location. With a Cathedral at each end of the road, the magnificent Philharmonic Dining Rooms a short distance away and the Albert Docks fifteen minutes walk, it would be hard to find a better place to stay. Our room was on the fourth floor with lovely views towards the Catholic Cathedral. The room was large, clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was equally nice with a lovely wet room shower. Our only problem was with breakfast in The London Carriage Works. We wanted the Liverpool breakfast and had to wait 40 mins each morning for a breakfast to arrive (not necessarily the one we ordered!) but reception dealt with our complaint professionally and our experience at breakfast would not put us off returning here or recommending this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hope Street is a smart but very friendly hotel with a really lovely restaurant.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent restaurant, very helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night, and from the minute we arrived to the time we left enjoyed our stay. There were a number of nice touches which made the stay feel special, but the highlight was the food. The restaurant was excellent, and very good value on the set menu. But the breakfast was equally good, with an emphasis on fresh and quality produce.
reviews.title: What could be better?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hope Street Hotel over Christmas and had a wonderful time. This was our second stay at the hotel and as with our last visit the would like to thank the staff for all their help, we found the staff most pleasant and efficient. A nice touch of homemade mince pies on arrival at reception was a really welcome start after our long snowy journey. The beds have to be the most comfortable beds ever (the only times I haven't been glad to get home to my own bed is after our stays in this hotel ...amazing). The rooms are comfortable and considering the extreme December temperatures the rooms were lovely and warm.
reviews.title: Extra Special Christmas at the Hope Street Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to have Christmas lunch in the London Carriage Works (the hotel's restaurant) which was amazing and highly recommended. The staff really made this an extra special occasion for our family.
reviews.title: A classy stay in historic Liverpool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are looking for an excellent , comfortable and convenient place to stay in Liverpool, try this hotel - it is not your `run of the mill' chain hotel - they really seem to care about their customers here. Looking forward to our next stay.
reviews.title: A very enjoyable and comfortable stay - very friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: From the moment we parked up in Hope Street right outside this spectacular hotel we were delighted by the friendly professional welcome here. We were shown to a beautiful room with abundant character,which was fully equipped down to the smallest detail. Downstairs again one of the keen and ever-helpful reception staff showed me over to the car park despite icy conditions underfoot. Dinner in the restaurant (and traditional breakfast next morning) was a great experience .The well-stocked bar provided us with ample choice of quality refreshment. After a wonderful night's sleep we agreed that we must definitely return on our next visit to Merseyside to this excellent establishment.
reviews.title: Glorious surroundings with gorgeous food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel over Christmas. The staff were welcoming and went out of their way to do stuff for us. They were particularly helpful in meeting the needs of our parents which made the Christmas holiday much more relaxing.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Lazy Sunday deal including 2 course evening meal and breakfast. Our room was comfortable but sleep was disturbed by guests talking loudly in the corridor between 2am and 4am (obviously not the hotel's fault). The Liverpool Breakfast was very good - our only complaint was the cold, matter-of-fact service from our waitress, just as we had during our meal in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Let Down (Again) By Inexperienced Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My gripe (and note: in all my reviews to date on Trip Advisor I've never written negative stuff) is that although the hotel Reception staff were welcoming, the bar and restaurant staff appeared young, inexperienced and characterless. My partner and I have eaten at the hotel's restaurant (London Carriage Works) many times because the food is very good but we are becoming increasingly fed up by the staff. Here are some examples: a waitress who opened our wine and poured it almost to the top of the (very large) glass; waitress who opened and poured wine without asking us to taste it; waitress repeatedly delivered meals and seemed unable to tell the difference between pigeon, pork and lamb; waitress not asking whether we enjoyed the food during the meal; taking the bill without saying thank you; waitress allowing us to walk past her without looking up to say thank you/good night, etc. This to me doesn't seem the right attitude and I can't think of any good restaurant I've been who would repeatedly allow this to happen, probably because establishments at this level usually train staff to make guests feel welcome and to show some interest in their dining experience. We never seem to see any experienced staff, front of house manager or anyone who appears to be in charge of proceedings. Moral of the story? This establishment could and should do better.
reviews.title: Absoultley Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: I can't believe the poor reviews on here! Nothing at all like our experience.
reviews.title: Very disappointing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only here for one night so I will review the areas we came into contact with;
reviews.title: Lots of promise unfulfilled

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - Clean, clean and spotlessly clean, so clean you could eat your dinner off the floor! The walls were so white it looked like they had been freshly painted. Saw a comment about the towels and ours were soft & fresh, bed was HUGE and we had a sofa bed for our 15yr old and a Z Bed for our 6 yr old and all of the linen was immaculate. Everyone commented on how comfortable the beds were and how well they slept
reviews.title: A warm reception but a cold room!

description: 89 individually designed hotel rooms, solid wood floors warmed by under floor heating and king sized beds draped in Egyptian cotton. Wall mounted LCD wide screen TVs, DVD players and Arne Jacobsen telephones, along with complimentary wi-fi access in every room. Rain dance showerheads the size of dinner plates and Vola fittings complement timeless bathrooms that also include huge soft towels, mist free mirrors and REN products.Views include the river, a world heritage skyline, the cathedrals, traditional Hope Place and Hope Street. Picture windows and skylights capture some of the stunning architecture that fills this part of the city and surrounds the hotel.
